Because it I think it's silly to play poker online for "funny money". ESPECIALLY when if you run out of chips you have to purchase more play chips with REAL money!

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												So we're letting scammers (Chris Ferguson & Co), whose domain was at one point seized by the FBI, advertise their shady product on Steam? I'm talking about an organization that the U.S. Justice Department filed a civil complaint against for allegedly running a Ponzi scheme, and this is getting the stamp of approval from Valve - one of the most respected video-game businesses out there? This is perhaps the biggest example of why Steam Greenlight is flawed like a bottomless bucket. Get it out of here!More information:https://legitorscam.org/full-tilt-poker-is-a-scam/http://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424053111904106704576582741398633386https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_v._Scheinberg

number of helpful: 9 of 12 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
Originally posted by Wikipedia:United States v. Scheinberg, 10 Cr. 336 (2011), is a United States federal criminal case against the founders of the three largest online poker companies, PokerStars, Full Tilt Poker and Cereus (Absolute Poker/Ultimatebet), and a handful of their associates,[1] which alleges that the defendants violated the Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act (UIGEA) and engaged in bank fraud and money laundering to process transfers to and from their customers.[1] A companion civil case, United States v. PokerStars, et al., 11 Civ. 2564 (2011),[2] includes Full Tilt and Cereus as defendants and seeks the recovery of forfeiture equaling approximately $3 billion in assets belonging to the companies.Yes, that's right, the devs of this game are literally criminals. They were forbidden from having real money pay. Guess what though? They lied. It's on here. On top of all of that it's not even real gambling because you can't withdraw it. Avoid it at all costs and report to the local authorities.

content:
Posted: January 27, 2016
												It's the same client you can download from their .net site (most pokersites use .net for playmoney and .com for realmoney). You get 1000 playmoney and you can get 1000 more when it's gone for free. If you want to play higher playmoney stakes you have 2 options: 1 - Grind it up with your 1000 starting bankroll2 - Buy playmoney chips.But why would anyone buy playmoney chips for real money? Or why would you wanna play with playmoney? Here is my advice:Just start playing with real money! You can sit at a realmoney table for as low as $ 0,80 at the 1 and 2 cent blind tables. Realmoney tables also plays a whole lot different than playmoney tables, it's almost uncomparible. If you wanna learn to play poker better do it at a real money table. There are many poker affiliate sites (just google) that will give a small bankroll for free. That way you can learn poker on realmoney tables without actually risking anything ! If you lose it all, it doesn't matter, cause you didn't spend any money. And if you are good enough to be winning, than you have found a new profitable hobby.So, pay to play playmoney poker or get free money and play real poker?I'm wondering how much money steam got from FTP to put this in the store.

content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												Funny, how all the people are crying about spending real money on a poker site and that it's gambling. Guys, poker is a sport like chess, some are good some are bad. Or what do you think how players like Phil Hellmuth won so much bracelets at the WSOP? Definitely not because he had so much luck, it's skill. Sure, when you go all-in with every ♥♥♥♥♥♥ hand, you gamble. And playing with real money is part of the game. So get used to it. Some other people crying about that the site is owned by scamers like Howard Lederer and Chris Ferguson. That's not the truth. Pokerstars bought and reopened Full Tilt and all players who got scamed by the old owners got there bankroll back. So please, don't spread lies around. Full Tilt is a trustful pokersite, owned by the biggest pokersite in the world. They don't need to scam, they earn enough money by the rake you produce while playing.

content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
												Full Tilt is a great online poker game with Fake and Real money.By signing up you do gain access to a limited amount of Free play Chips for Free Play Games.This is not a 100% free chips game like Zynga Poker, this is a real money game and that DOES NOT make it bad.I'm reading countless bad reviews purely because this game requires you to bet (and win) real money.All in all great poker game, very nicely presented and easy to use. Constant running tournaments for all different prices (Including Free Tournaments which you can win paid prize tickets on)
